p: Wound bacterial colonization presents a continuous challenge in the treatment of skin injuries and wound healing. Therefore, antibacterial activity of VOB was preliminarily assayed against the common Gram-positive Staphylococcus aureus bacteria and the Gram-negative Escherichia coli bacteria frequently hosted in cutaneous wounds ( 24). VOB exhibited only slight activity against S. aureus with a MIC value of 2000 µg/mL and did not exert any antibacterial activity against E. coli up to 2000 µg/mL.
